newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo car unit said in deal with GM.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo car unit said in deal with GM.

text.p: Daewoo Motor Co, a carmaking unit of South Korea's Daewoo Group, has been negotiating a joint venture deal with U.S. General Motors (GM), a leading newspaper said on Friday.

In Saturday's edition, Chosun Ilbo said Kim Woo-choong, chairman of the Daewoo Group recently discussed with GM executives the deal including joint development and production of new car models and GM's repurchase of Daewoo Motor's stake.
Daewoo officials were not available to comment.
The two companies severed an unhappy 15-year marriage in 1992 when the U.S. giant carmaker sold 50 percent stake in the South Korean joint venture.
